intro: Aragoa, commonly known as the "false hibiscus," is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a rough, hairy texture. Aragoa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can thrive in well-drained soil with ample sunlight.
